request_process.who_can_request: Any person (no residency requirement, no identity requirement)
request_process.how_to_request: Written or verbal request to appropriate agency; no specific form required
required_information: Request that fairly describes the public record or class of records sought

agency_response_time.acknowledgment: Within 1 business day of receiving request
agency_response_time.response: Reasonable period of time but not more than days stated in agency's policy

fees.mailing: May require advance payment of postage/delivery costs

request_process.appeals_process: Mandamus action in court of common pleas, supreme court, or court of appeals; prevailing party awarded court costs and attorney fees; statutory damages up to $1,000

key_exemptions: Records pertaining to probation, parole, and sexually violent predator proceedings
Attorney work product and privileged communications
Certain body camera and dashboard camera recordings
Records that would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of privacy
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
notable_features: Required public records policies for all agencies
Mandatory training requirements for elected officials
Statutory damages available ($100/day up to $1,000 maximum)
Cannot limit number of requests or items per request
Must provide assistance with ambiguous or overly broad requests
Required explanation with legal authority for any denials
Court costs and attorney fees for prevailing requesters
